newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares firm 0.39 pct to new record.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares firm 0.39 pct to new record.

text.p: The market index at Istanbul's stock exchange firmed on selective demand to a new all-time high close of 83,828.67 on Friday, compared to a previous record of 83,772.33 on October 23.

The IMKB-100 gained 323.30 points, or 0.39 percent from Thursday when it leapt 2.51 percent on strong selective buys. But it fell from a morning high of 84,747 on profit-taking. Weekly gains were 1.5 percent after last week's 0.83 percent.
Trade volume jumped to 21.29 trillion lira ($218.1 million) from Thursday's 17.39 trillion ($178.5 million).
"Players switched to cheaper shares to sustain the rise. The index may pierce 85,000 resistance next week," said Erol Guney from Yurtbank.

The index had surged 29.3 percent, breaking ten record closes from September 13 to October 23 in a medium-term uptrend which began with the breaching of 65,000 level. But it drifted lower in range-trading after meeting stiff resistance at 85,000.
